You can review the changes|here|.|music|community|Rock'n'Roll Ensemble - Marc Bolan & T​.​Rex (+ bonus tracks)|by|Marc Bolan & T.Rex|supported by|hannabolan94|the-electric-dandy|Suezan Elliott|jtbolan72|philhatchett|bolan222|nowheremanworld|lizzie07|Norbert Rahe|/|Digital Album|Streaming + Download|Includes unlimited streaming via the free Bandcamp app, plus high-quality download in MP3, FLAC and more.|Purchasable with gift card|Buy Digital Album|£4|GBP|or more|Send as Gift|Share|/ Embed|1.|Rock'n'Roll Ensemble (edited)|06:59|info|2.|Rock'n'Roll Ensemble (unedited)|15:26|info|3.|Woke Up This Morning|01:36|info|4.|Marc Bolan & Tony Visconti In The Studio Impersonating Bob Dylan|03:31|info|about|This album contains the elusive session that was known as the 'Marc Bolan & T.Rex Rock'n'Roll Ensemble'. Permission was given to Danielz & Caron Willans to release this by Bolan's catalogue management, Spirit Music Ltd, USA as it had never been heard in this untampered form before. It is an amazing insight to Marc's love of 1950s rock'n'roll. The session begins without the prior knowledge of the engineer who appears to flick the record switch instinctively part of the way through Little Richard's 'Rip It Up'. This recording is a fantastic and unique look into how Marc worked in the studio and his state of mind in that hazy period of 1974.
|marc bolan
|marc bolan t.rex

You can review the changes|here|.|music|community|Rock'n'Roll Ensemble - Marc Bolan & T​.​Rex (+ bonus tracks)|by|Marc Bolan & T.Rex|supported by|hannabolan94|the-electric-dandy|Suezan Elliott|jtbolan72|philhatchett|bolan222|nowheremanworld|lizzie07|Norbert Rahe|/|Digital Album|Streaming + Download|Includes unlimited streaming via the free Bandcamp app, plus high-quality download in MP3, FLAC and more.|Purchasable with gift card|Buy Digital Album|£4|GBP|or more|Send as Gift|Share|/ Embed|1.|Rock'n'Roll Ensemble (edited)|06:59|info|2.|Rock'n'Roll Ensemble (unedited)|15:26|info|3.|Woke Up This Morning|01:36|info|4.|Marc Bolan & Tony Visconti In The Studio Impersonating Bob Dylan|03:31|info|about|This album contains the elusive session that was known as the 'Marc Bolan & T.Rex Rock'n'Roll Ensemble'. Permission was given to Danielz & Caron Willans to release this by Bolan's catalogue management, Spirit Music Ltd, USA as it had never been heard in this untampered form before. It is an amazing insight to Marc's love of 1950s rock'n'roll. The session begins without the prior knowledge of the engineer who appears to flick the record switch instinctively part of the way through Little Richard's 'Rip It Up'. This recording is a fantastic and unique look into how Marc worked in the studio and his state of mind in that hazy period of 1974.
